Xi Jinping has consolidated his power significantly over the last decade, remaking the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) in his image. There are indications that he may remain in power beyond 2025, potentially until around 2035, as he has set this as a target for China to become a modernized great power[1][4].

There is no clear successor to Xi Jinping, which further solidifies his position. The focus on executing domestic reforms and maintaining his authority suggests that he will continue to lead without a clear transition plan in the immediate future[1].

## Current Challenges and Stability
While Xi faces various challenges, including economic headwinds, social unrest, and international tensions, his control over the PLA and the Party's apparatus is expected to maintain stability and ensure his continued leadership[2][3].

Given these points, it is reasonable to conclude that Xi Jinping will likely continue leading China through January 1, 2025.
